page.title: 16TRANSPORT
page.content: The Parish Council has no powers over Transport, but takes an interest in decisions that are being made.The Sec_ retary of State plans to close the Eridge to Tonbridge railway line.This is against peoples' wishes, the Eridge Line Support Group has been formed. Trains leave Crowborough for London & Uckfield and are used by commuters.3 mornings a week the Parish Council organise a free bus to take elderly people shopping in Crowboro'.Other residents use cars, bicycles or taxis. Many commuters live in Crowboro' be_ cause property is cheaper.Some travel from Crowboro' others drive to Tunbri_ dge Wells where trains are faster & more frequent.They find the journeys tiring and many would prefer to work in Crowborough if opportunities arose. It takes over an hour to reach London.
